qa_list.question: What is the name of the institute mentioned in the text?
qa_list.answer: Language Technologies Institute

qa_list.question: Who are the main categories of people that can be found at this institute according to the menu options provided?
qa_list.answer: The main categories of people mentioned in the text are faculty, staff, students/alumni, and visitors.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of the 'Faculty' section on this page?
qa_list.answer: The 'Faculty' section provides information about the Language Technologies Institute faculty members.

qa_list.question: How many types of faculty are mentioned in the text?
qa_list.answer: There are three types of faculty mentioned: Affiliated Faculty, Adjunct Faculty, and regular Faculty.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of the 'Research' section on this page?
qa_list.answer: The 'Research' section likely provides information about research conducted by faculty members at the Language Technologies Institute.

qa_list.question: According to the text, what is the purpose of the 'Partnership' section on this page?
qa_list.answer: The 'Partnership' section likely provides information about partnerships or collaborations that the Language Technologies Institute has established with other institutions.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of the 'Apply' button in the text?
qa_list.answer: The 'Apply' button allows individuals to apply for academic programs at the Language Technologies Institute.

qa_list.question: According to the menu options, what are some of the main activities that take place at this institute?
qa_list.answer: Some of the main activities mentioned in the text include academics (presumably referring to academic programs and research), partnership (likely referring to collaborations with other institutions), and research.

qa_list.question: What is the name of the institute's intranet?
qa_list.answer: The LTI Intranet

qa_list.question: Who are the professors mentioned in this text?
qa_list.answer: The professors mentioned in this text are Bhiksha Ramakrishnan, Carolyn Rosé, Alexander Rudnicky, Maarten Sap, Michael Shamos, Rita Singh, Emma Strubell, Alexander Waibel, and Shinji Watanabe.

qa_list.question: What is the research area of Bhiksha Ramakrishnan?
qa_list.answer: The research area of Bhiksha Ramakrishnan is Machine Learning, Multimodal Computing and Interaction, Speech Processing, Spoken Interfaces and Dialogue Processing, Privacy.

qa_list.question: What are the phone numbers provided for Carolyn Rosé?
qa_list.answer: The phone number provided for Carolyn Rosé is 412-268-7130.

qa_list.question: Where does Alexander Rudnicky work?
qa_list.answer: Alexander Rudnicky works in the Gates & Hillman Centers at Carnegie Mellon University.

qa_list.question: What is Maarten Sap's research area?
qa_list.answer: Maarten Sap's research areas are Multimodal Computing and Interaction, Speech Processing, Spoken Interfaces and Dialogue Processing.

qa_list.question: What is Michael Shamos' title at Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: Michael Shamos holds the title of Distinguished Career Professor at Carnegie Mellon University.

qa_list.question: Where does Rita Singh work?
qa_list.answer: Rita Singh works in the Gates & Hillman Centers at Carnegie Mellon University.

qa_list.question: What is Emma Strubel's research area?
qa_list.answer: Emma Strubel's research areas are Fairness and Ethics in Language Technology, Computational Social Science, Discourse and Pragmatics, Conversational AI, Intelligent Agents, and Dialogue.

qa_list.question: What is Alexander Waibel's office location?
qa_list.answer: Alexander Waibel works in the Gates & Hillman Centers at Carnegie Mellon University.

qa_list.question: What are the research areas of Shinji Watanabe?
qa_list.answer: Shinji Watanabe's research areas include Spoken Language Translation, Machine Translation, Speech Processing, Neural Networks, Machine Learning, Multimodal Interaction, and Dialog Processing.

qa_list.question: What are the research areas of Sean Welleck?
qa_list.answer: Sean Welleck's research areas include Natural Language Processing: Conversational AI, Intelligent Agents, and Dialogue, Speech Processing (ASR, Speech Synthesis): Speech Recognition, Speech Synthesis, Multilingual/Low-Resource Speech Processing, Speech-to-Speech Translation, Speech Enhancement / Robust Speech Processing.

qa_list.question: Who is the Professor starting in January 2024?
qa_list.answer: Sean Welleck will be starting as an Assistant Professor in January 2024.

qa_list.question: What are Eric P. Xing's research areas?
qa_list.answer: Eric P. Xing's research areas include Natural Language Processing: Conversational AI, Intelligent Agents, and Dialogue, Speech Processing (ASR, Speech Synthesis): Speech Recognition, Speech Synthesis, Multilingual/Low-Resource Speech Processing, Speech-to-Speech Translation, Speech Enhancement / Robust Speech Processing.

qa_list.question: Who is Chenyan Xiong?
qa_list.answer: Chenyan Xiong is an Associate Professor at Carnegie Mellon University.

qa_list.question: What are Yiming Yang's research areas?
qa_list.answer: Yiming Yang's research areas include Natural Language Processing: Conversational AI, Intelligent Agents, and Dialogue, Speech Processing (ASR, Speech Synthesis): Speech Recognition, Speech Synthesis, Multilingual/Low-Resource Speech Processing, Speech-to-Speech Translation, Speech Enhancement / Robust Speech Processing.

qa_list.question: What is the office number of Chenyan Xiong?
qa_list.answer: Chenyan Xiong's office number is 8101 Gates & Hillman Centers.

qa_list.question: Who is Yiming Yang's research areas related to?
qa_list.answer: Yiming Yang's research areas are related to Natural Language Processing: Conversational AI, Intelligent Agents, and Dialogue, Speech Processing (ASR, Speech Synthesis): Speech Recognition, Speech Synthesis, Multilingual/Low-Resource Speech Processing, Speech-to-Speech Translation, Speech Enhancement / Robust Speech Processing.

qa_list.question: What is the office number of Yiming Yang?
qa_list.answer: Yiming Yang's office number is 6717 Gates & Hillman Centers.

qa_list.answer: The address of Language Technologies Institute is 5000 Forbes Avenue, Pittsburgh, PA 15213-3891.
